intro: Epipactis grandiflora, commonly known as the large-flowered helleborine, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the orchid family (Orchidaceae) and is characterized by its tall, erect stems and large, showy greenish-yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and meadows. Its leaves are broad and lance-shaped, and it produces small, greenish-brown capsules as fruit. Epipactis grandiflora is known for its ability to thrive in humid environments and is often found in association with other shade-tolerant flora.
